intro: Senecio paucijugus, commonly known as the few-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
